channel.title: [pi] player command
channel.description: Can anyone help me come up with a ::players command that opens an interface and shows who is online and their level?

item.title: [pi] player command
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

okay well tell us why they do not work.

item.title: [pi] player command
item.dc:creator: @mrpyro3 mrpyro3
item.description:
@mrpyro3 wrote:

[quote=“thock321, post:9, topic:406003”][code] if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase(“players”)) {
c.sendMessage(“There are currently “+PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount()+ " players online.”);
c.getPA().sendFrame126(Config.SERVER_NAME+” - Online Players", 8144);
c.getPA().sendFrame126("@dbl@Online players(" + PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount()+ “):”, 8145);
int line = 8147;
for (int i = 1; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) {
Client p = c.getClient(i);
if (!c.validClient(i))
continue;
if (p.playerName != null) {
String title = “”;
if (p.playerRights == 1) {
title = "Mod, ";
} else if (p.playerRights == 2) {
title = "Admin, ";
}
title += “level-” + p.combatLevel;
String extra = “”;
if (c.playerRights > 0) {
extra = “(” + p.playerId + “) “;
}
c.getPA().sendFrame126(”@dre@” + extra + p.playerName +

“@dbl@ (”+ title + ") is at " + p.absX + ", "+ p.absY, line);
line++;
}
}
c.getPA().showInterface(8134);
c.flushOutStream();
}[/code]
and also you need this method in your client.java

public boolean validClient(int index) { Client p = (Client) PlayerHandler.players[index]; if ((p != null) && !p.disconnected) { return true; } return false; }[/quote]
src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:223: getClient(java.lang.String)
in server.model.players.Client cannot be applied to (int)
Client p = c.getClient(i);
^
Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details.
1 error
Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic

item.title: [pi] player command
item.dc:creator: @thock321 thock321
item.description:
@thock321 wrote:

[code] if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase(“players”)) {
c.sendMessage(“There are currently “+PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount()+ " players online.”);
c.getPA().sendFrame126(Config.SERVER_NAME+” - Online Players", 8144);
c.getPA().sendFrame126("@dbl@Online players(" + PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount()+ “):”, 8145);
int line = 8147;
for (int i = 1; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) {
Client p = c.getClient(i);
if (!c.validClient(i))
continue;
if (p.playerName != null) {
String title = “”;
if (p.playerRights == 1) {
title = "Mod, ";
} else if (p.playerRights == 2) {
title = "Admin, ";
}
title += “level-” + p.combatLevel;
String extra = “”;
if (c.playerRights > 0) {
extra = “(” + p.playerId + “) “;
}
c.getPA().sendFrame126(”@dre@” + extra + p.playerName +

“@dbl@ (”+ title + ") is at " + p.absX + ", "+ p.absY, line);
line++;
}
}
c.getPA().showInterface(8134);
c.flushOutStream();
}[/code]
and also you need this method in your client.java

public boolean validClient(int index) { Client p = (Client) PlayerHandler.players[index]; if ((p != null) && !p.disconnected) { return true; } return false; }

Read full topic

item.title: [pi] player command
item.dc:creator: @mrpyro3 mrpyro3
item.description:
@mrpyro3 wrote:

[quote=“saadmboy, post:7, topic:406003”] if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("players")) { c.sendMessage("There are currently "+PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount()+ " players online."); c.getPA().sendFrame126(Config.SERVER_NAME+" - Online Players", 8144); c.getPA().sendFrame126("@dbl@Online players(" + PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount()+ "):", 8145); int line = 8147; for (int i = 1; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) { Client c2 = c.getClient(Server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName); if (!c.validClient(i)) continue; if (c2.playerName != null) { String title = ""; if (c2.playerRights == 1) { title = "Mod, "; } else if (c2.playerRights == 2) { title = "Admin, "; } else if (c2.playerRights == 3) { title = "Owner, "; } else if (c2.playerRights == 4) { title = "Donator, "; } else if (c2.playerRights == 5) { title = "Super Donator, "; } title += "level-" + c2.combatLevel; String extra = ""; if (c.playerRights > 0) { extra = "(" + c2.playerId + ") "; } c.getPA().sendFrame126("@dre@" + extra + c2.playerName + "@dbl@ ("+ title + ") is at " + c2.absX + ", "+ c2.absY, line); line++; } } c.getPA().showInterface(8134); c.flushOutStream(); }

Hope it works[/quote]
error:
src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:224: cannot find symbol
symbol : method validClient(int)
location: class server.model.players.Client
if (!c.validClient(i))
^
Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details.
1 error
Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic

item.title: [pi] player command
item.dc:creator: @saadmboy saadmboy
item.description:
@saadmboy wrote:

if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("players")) { c.sendMessage("There are currently "+PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount()+ " players online."); c.getPA().sendFrame126(Config.SERVER_NAME+" - Online Players", 8144); c.getPA().sendFrame126("@dbl@Online players(" + PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount()+ "):", 8145); int line = 8147; for (int i = 1; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) { Client c2 = c.getClient(Server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName); if (!c.validClient(i)) continue; if (c2.playerName != null) { String title = ""; if (c2.playerRights == 1) { title = "Mod, "; } else if (c2.playerRights == 2) { title = "Admin, "; } else if (c2.playerRights == 3) { title = "Owner, "; } else if (c2.playerRights == 4) { title = "Donator, "; } else if (c2.playerRights == 5) { title = "Super Donator, "; } title += "level-" + c2.combatLevel; String extra = ""; if (c.playerRights > 0) { extra = "(" + c2.playerId + ") "; } c.getPA().sendFrame126("@dre@" + extra + c2.playerName + "@dbl@ ("+ title + ") is at " + c2.absX + ", "+ c2.absY, line); line++; } } c.getPA().showInterface(8134); c.flushOutStream(); }

Hope it works

item.title: [pi] player command
item.dc:creator: @zach55200 zach55200
item.description:
@zach55200 wrote:

Here ya go

if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("players")) { c.sendMessage("There are currently "+PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount()+ " players online."); c.getPA().sendFrame126(Config.SERVER_NAME+" - Online Players", 8144); c.getPA().sendFrame126("@dbl@Online players(" + PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount()+ "):", 8145); int line = 8147; for (int i = 1; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) { Client p = c.getClient(i); if (!c.validClient(i)) continue; if (p.playerName != null) { String title = ""; if (p.playerRights == 1) { title = "Mod, "; } else if (p.playerRights == 2) { title = "Admin, "; } title += "level-" + p.combatLevel; String extra = ""; if (c.playerRights > 0) { extra = "(" + p.playerId + ") "; } c.getPA().sendFrame126("@dre@" + extra + p.playerName + "@dbl@ ("+ title + ") is at " + p.absX + ", "+ p.absY, line); line++; } } c.getPA().showInterface(8134); c.flushOutStream(); }

item.title: [pi] player command
item.dc:creator: @sombohdi sombohdi
item.description:
@sombohdi wrote:

Go to your server source and find “commands.java” Then your proably going to add it if its not already there. So find a spot in the file and type something like.
if commands (“players”)…
send.message(“there are currently " +c.playercount +” online);
or if you want an interface to show it you need do
C.openinterface(“12405”)
sendframe126(“Players online”,29052);
Then put
C.SmfdNoob(“trololol”, 29053);

Read full topic
